article.headline: Coronavirus tally: Global cases of COVID-19 13.8 million, 590,401 deaths as U.S.sets global case record
article.body: The global tally for confirmed cases of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 climbed to 13.8 million on Friday, according to data aggregated by Johns Hopkins University, and the death toll rose to 590,401. At least 7.7 million people have recovered. The U.S. recorded a record of more than 70,000 new cases in a single day, the highest reported by any country since the start of the outbreak. The U.S. now has 3.58 million cases, or about a quarter of the global total, and 138,360 deaths. Florida, the new U.S. hot spot, added almost 14,000 new cases overnight, and now has 315,767 with 4,676 deaths, or 22 per 100,000, according to a New York Times tracker. Brazil is second to the U.S. with 2.01 million cases and 76,688 deaths. India is third measured by cases after its tally climbed above 1 million, followed by Russia with 758,001 and Peru with 341,586. The U.K. has 45,204 fatalities, the highest in Europe and third highest in the world. China, where the illness was first reported late last year, has 85,314 cases and 4,644 fatalities.
